extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.email.ConsumeIMAP
extension.description: Consumes messages from Email Server using IMAP protocol. The raw-bytes of each received email message are written as contents of the FlowFile

property.name: host
property.description: Network address of Email server (e.g., pop.gmail.com, imap.gmail.com . . .)

property.name: port
property.description: Numeric value identifying Port of Email server (e.g., 993)

property.name: authorization-mode
property.description: How to authorize sending email on the user's behalf.

allowableValue.description: Use OAuth2 to acquire access token

property.name: oauth2-access-token-provider
property.description: OAuth2 service that can provide access tokens.

property.name: user
property.description: User Name used for authentication and authorization with Email server.

property.name: password
property.description: Password used for authentication and authorization with Email server.

property.name: folder
property.description: Email folder to retrieve messages from (e.g., INBOX)

property.name: fetch.size
property.description: Specify the maximum number of Messages to fetch per call to Email Server.

property.name: delete.messages
property.description: Specify whether mail messages should be deleted after retrieval.

property.name: connection.timeout
property.description: The amount of time to wait to connect to Email server

property.name: Mark Messages as Read
property.description: Specify if messages should be marked as read after retrieval.

property.name: Use SSL
property.description: Specifies if IMAP connection must be obtained via SSL encrypted connection (i.e., IMAPS)

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All messages that are the are successfully received from Email server and converted to FlowFiles are routed to this relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.email.ConsumePOP3
extension.description: Consumes messages from Email Server using POP3 protocol. The raw-bytes of each received email message are written as contents of the FlowFile

property.name: host
property.description: Network address of Email server (e.g., pop.gmail.com, imap.gmail.com . . .)

property.name: port
property.description: Numeric value identifying Port of Email server (e.g., 993)

property.name: authorization-mode
property.description: How to authorize sending email on the user's behalf.

allowableValue.description: Use OAuth2 to acquire access token

property.name: oauth2-access-token-provider
property.description: OAuth2 service that can provide access tokens.

property.name: user
property.description: User Name used for authentication and authorization with Email server.

property.name: password
property.description: Password used for authentication and authorization with Email server.

property.name: folder
property.description: Email folder to retrieve messages from (e.g., INBOX)

property.name: fetch.size
property.description: Specify the maximum number of Messages to fetch per call to Email Server.

property.name: delete.messages
property.description: Specify whether mail messages should be deleted after retrieval.

property.name: connection.timeout
property.description: The amount of time to wait to connect to Email server

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All messages that are the are successfully received from Email server and converted to FlowFiles are routed to this relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.email.ExtractEmailAttachments
extension.description: Extract attachments from a mime formatted email file, splitting them into individual flowfiles.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Flowfiles that could not be parsed

relationship.name: attachments
relationship.description: Each individual attachment will be routed to the attachments relationship

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename of the attachment

writesAttribute.name: email.attachment.parent.filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename of the parent FlowFile

writesAttribute.name: email.attachment.parent.uuid
writesAttribute.description: The UUID of the original FlowFile.

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The mime type of the attachment.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.email.ExtractEmailHeaders
extension.description: Using the flowfile content as source of data, extract header from an RFC compliant email file adding the relevant attributes to the flowfile. This processor does not perform extensive RFC validation but still requires a bare minimum compliance with RFC 2822

property.name: CAPTURED_HEADERS
property.description: COLON separated list of additional headers to be extracted from the flowfile content.NOTE the header key is case insensitive and will be matched as lower-case. Values will respect email contents.

property.name: STRICT_ADDRESS_PARSING
property.description: If "strict", strict address format parsing rules are applied to mailbox and mailbox list fields, such as "to" and "from" headers, and FlowFiles with poorly formed addresses will be routed to the failure relationship, similar to messages that fail RFC compliant format validation. If "non-strict", the processor will extract the contents of mailbox list headers as comma-separated values without attempting to parse each value as well-formed Internet mailbox addresses. This is optional and defaults to Strict Address Parsing

allowableValue.description: Strict email address format will be enforced. FlowFiles will be transfered to the failure relationship if the email address is invalid.
Accept emails, even if the address is poorly formed and doesn't strictly comply with RFC Validation.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Flowfiles that could not be parsed as a RFC-2822 compliant message

writesAttribute.name: email.headers.bcc.*
writesAttribute.description: Each individual BCC recipient (if available)

writesAttribute.name: email.headers.cc.*
writesAttribute.description: Each individual CC recipient (if available)

writesAttribute.name: email.headers.from.*
writesAttribute.description: Each individual mailbox contained in the From of the Email (array as per RFC-2822)

writesAttribute.name: email.headers.message-id
writesAttribute.description: The value of the Message-ID header (if available)

writesAttribute.name: email.headers.received_date
writesAttribute.description: The Received-Date of the message (if available)

writesAttribute.name: email.headers.sent_date
writesAttribute.description: Date the message was sent

writesAttribute.name: email.headers.subject
writesAttribute.description: Subject of the message (if available)

writesAttribute.name: email.headers.to.*
writesAttribute.description: Each individual TO recipient (if available)

writesAttribute.name: email.attachment_count
writesAttribute.description: Number of attachments of the message

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.email.ExtractTNEFAttachments
extension.description: Extract attachments from a mime formatted email file, splitting them into individual flowfiles.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Each individual flowfile that could not be parsed will be routed to the failure relationship

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: Each original flowfile (i.e. before extraction) will be routed to the original relationship

relationship.name: attachments
relationship.description: Each individual attachment will be routed to the attachments relationship

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename of the attachment

writesAttribute.name: email.tnef.attachment.parent.filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename of the parent FlowFile

writesAttribute.name: email.tnef.attachment.parent.uuid
writesAttribute.description: The UUID of the original FlowFile.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.email.ListenSMTP
extension.description: This processor implements a lightweight SMTP server to an arbitrary port, allowing nifi to listen for incoming email. Note this server does not perform any email validation. If direct exposure to the internet is sought, it may be a better idea to use the combination of NiFi and an industrial scale MTA (e.g. Postfix). Threading for this processor is managed by the underlying smtp server used so the processor need not support more than one thread.

property.name: SMTP_PORT
property.description: The TCP port the ListenSMTP processor will bind to.NOTE that on Unix derivative operating systems this port must be higher than 1024 unless NiFi is running as with root user permissions.

property.name: SMTP_MAXIMUM_CONNECTIONS
property.description: The maximum number of simultaneous SMTP connections.

property.name: SMTP_TIMEOUT
property.description: The maximum time to wait for an action of SMTP client.

property.name: SMTP_MAXIMUM_MSG_SIZE
property.description: The maximum number of bytes the server will accept.

property.name: SSL_CONTEXT_SERVICE
property.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context. If this property is set, messages will be received over a secure connection.

property.name: CLIENT_AUTH
property.description: The client authentication policy to use for the SSL Context. Only used if an SSL Context Service is provided.

property.name: SMTP_HOSTNAME
property.description: The hostname to be embedded into the banner displayed when an SMTP client connects to the processor TCP port .

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All new messages will be routed as FlowFiles to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: smtp.helo
writesAttribute.description: The value used during HELO

writesAttribute.name: smtp.certificates.*.serial
writesAttribute.description: The serial numbers for each of the certificates used by an TLS peer

writesAttribute.name: smtp.certificates.*.principal
writesAttribute.description: The principal for each of the certificates used by an TLS peer

writesAttribute.name: smtp.src
writesAttribute.description: The source IP and port of the SMTP connection

writesAttribute.name: smtp.from
writesAttribute.description: The value used during MAIL FROM (i.e. envelope)

writesAttribute.name: smtp.recipient.*
writesAttribute.description: The values used during RCPT TO (i.e. envelope)

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: Mime type of the message
